Wander into the swanky, velvet-lined lobby for a sight, we’ll admit, more stunning that 1 World Trade. GKV Architects and Martin Brudnizki Design Studio transformed the sleepy office building into a golden-hued, 287-room hotel, connected by inner balconies that make the atrium the focal point. Come for the sun-drenched space, but stay for the star-studded hotel restaurants—Tom Colicchio’s veg-forward Temple Court and Keith McNally’s French bistro-like Augustine—and a very good night's sleep.THE VIBE IS: a little nutty, but the masters of New York City hospitality got you. The restaurants can fill up quickly at prime time with tourists and bankers, but just put your name down at either of the restaurants, then hit up the bar in that stunning lobby for liquid destressing supplied by Temple Court.PRACTICAL STUFF: Rates start at $350.—Elyse InamineAlex LauWE ALSO LOVEVoyager EspressoThe futuristic Aussie cafe hidden in a Lower Manhattan subway stationKeens SteakhouseNYC’s classic midtown steakhouse—still perfect after all these yearsArcade BakeryThe Tribeca office building bakery of your dreamsExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
